body_content.explanation: (of a person, an organization, a country, etc.) the practice of intentionally keeping yourself separate from other people, organizations, etc. :
examples: Self-isolation appears to be more frequent in people with histories of avoiding attachment.
Japan was opened to foreign ideas and culture after 200 years of self-isolation.

body_content.explanation: the practice of not leaving your house and of staying away from other people when you have, or may have, an infectious disease, so that you do not infect anyone else:
examples: Self-isolation is about protecting others and slowing down the spread of infectious diseases.
The Government is advising self-isolation for anyone who has travelled back from an area where the coronavirus is known to be present.
